item.title: 'Calm down': Ravi Shastri on Rishabh Pant's bizarre dismissal at MCG - The Times of India
item.description:
Calm down: Ravi Shastri on Rishabh Pant's bizarre dismissal at MCG

Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

In a crucial phase of Day 3 at the MCG, Rishabh Pant's risky shot selection led to his dismissal, sparking debate among fans and experts about his aggressive playing style.

  • Pant attempted a scoop shot against Scott Boland but was caught out, leaving India at 191/5.
  • Criticism of Pant's shot selection included comments from cricketer Sunil Gavaskar, who labeled it “stupid.”
  • Ravi Shastri defended Pant, suggesting that it’s important to assess the context of his dismissals across innings.
  • Shastri emphasized the need for Pant to adapt his approach during matches and play with maturity.
“It's not in every innings he has attempted that shot... Let’s calm down here, guys. It’s not every time he’s throwing it away.” - Ravi Shastri

Shastri also remarked on Pant's propensity for high-risk shots, noting that while they can be effective, they must be executed wisely in changing game situations.

item.title: Unimech Aerospace IPO Listing On Tuesday: GMP At 91.08% Indicates Robust Gains For Investors - News18
item.description:
Unimech Aerospace IPO Listing On Tuesday: GMP At 91.08% Indicates Robust Gains For Investors

Date: December 28, 2024
Source: News18

The Unimech Aerospace IPO is set to list on December 31, showing a 91.08% premium over its issue price of Rs 785, indicating significant investor interest.

  • The IPO received a remarkable 184.34 times subscription.
  • Unimech Aerospace shares are currently trading at Rs 1,500 in the grey market.
  • The listing will take place on both BSE and NSE.
  • The price band of the IPO was between Rs 745 and 785.
“Grey market premium indicates investors’ readiness to pay more than the issue price.”

This IPO is significant for its robust subscription figures and the expectation of solid gains for investors on its upcoming listing.

item.title: 7 amazing cosmology pictures by NASA Hubble Space Telescope - India.com
item.description:
7 Amazing Cosmology Pictures by NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Publication Date: [Insert Date] Source: India.com

This article features stunning images captured by the NASA Hubble Space Telescope, showcasing the wonders of the universe through cosmology.

  • Lensing cluster Abell 383: A giant galaxy cluster showing the effect of dark matter bending light.
  • Hubble’s colourful view of the Universe: A detailed and colorful portrait of the evolving Universe.
  • Dark matter ring discovery: An international team found a ghostly ring formed by colliding galaxy clusters.
  • Cosmic Snake: A galaxy with regions of intense star formation affected by gravitational lensing.
  • Rings of Relativity: A unique cosmic phenomenon featuring a galaxy elegantly curving around another.
  • Astronomy in Action: A rare celestial phenomenon showcased in a striking Hubble image.
  • Ghost light from dead galaxies: Pandoras Cluster captured in a ghostly Hubble view.
Astronomers have utilized Hubble’s capability to capture detailed and colorful images of phenomena that would otherwise remain unseen.

This collection of images serves as a reminder of the incredible capabilities of the Hubble Space Telescope and its contributions to our understanding of the cosmos.

item.title: 5 mentally stimulating jobs that can prevent Alzheimer's, dementia - The Times of India
item.description:
5 Mentally Stimulating Jobs That Can Prevent Alzheimer's and Dementia

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

A recent study highlights the importance of mentally stimulating jobs in reducing the risk of cognitive decline and dementia as we age.

  • Individuals in least mentally demanding jobs face a higher risk of cognitive decline.
  • Professions such as teaching, medicine, scientific research, management, and law are crucial in maintaining mental sharpness.
  • Those in less demanding roles have a 66% greater risk of mild cognitive impairment and a 31% greater risk of dementia post-70.
“Mentally stimulating jobs through life are linked to a decreased incidence of dementia and Alzheimer's disease.”

In conclusion, choosing a mentally stimulating job can significantly contribute to maintaining cognitive health and preventing serious conditions like Alzheimer's and dementia.

item.title: Donald Trump breaks silence on H-1B row, supports Elon-Vivek: 'It's a great program' - The Times of India
item.description:
Donald Trump breaks silence on H-1B row, supports Elon-Vivek: 'It's a great program'

Publication Date: 2023-10-20 Source: Times of India

In a recent statement, Donald Trump expressed his support for the H-1B visa program, siding with notable figures such as Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy amidst ongoing debates regarding the program's impact on the job market.

  • Trump declares H-1B as a 'great program' beneficial for innovation and technology sectors.
  • The statement aims to quell concerns over the program's influence on American jobs.
  • Musk and Ramaswamy have also been vocal supporters of revising the program to attract global talent.
"It's a great program that helps bring in the best and brightest minds to America." - Donald Trump

This support could shift the narrative around H-1B visas, potentially influencing future immigration policies.

item.title: Jameela Jamil rips Hollywood amid ‘era of Ozempic heroin chic’ after eating disorder battle - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Jameela Jamil rips Hollywood amid ‘era of Ozempic heroin chic’ after eating disorder battle

Publication Date: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Jameela Jamil, the actress known for her past struggles with anorexia, has openly criticized Hollywood for promoting an unhealthy 'Ozempic heroin chic' culture through her social media. She shared a video asserting her commitment to maintain her mental health despite industry pressures.

  • Jamil's Instagram video features her celebrating body positivity while dancing in a swimsuit.
  • She expresses concern about the body-shaming culture fueled by weight loss drugs like Ozempic.
  • In a reflective throwback, she reveals the struggles faced during her anorexia battle.
  • Jamil suggests that the trend of extreme thinness is harmful and questions its impact on youth.
  • She vows not to conform to damaging beauty standards.
“What are we teaching the kids?” – Jameela Jamil questioning Hollywood's impact on young audiences.

Jameela Jamil's candid remarks highlight ongoing issues regarding body image and the pressures faced by individuals in the entertainment industry.

item.title: Nitish Kumar Reddy blossoms to give India hope as century stalls Australia - The Guardian
item.description:
Nitish Kumar Reddy Shines as India Gains Hope in Test Against Australia

Publication Date: Date not provided | Source: News Source Not Specified

Nitish Kumar Reddy's remarkable century in the ongoing Test series against Australia has shifted focus from veteran players to young talent, showcasing his potential at just 21 years of age and bringing India back into contention during a challenging match.

  • Reddy scored his first Test century at a critical time for India, recovering from 358 for nine while chasing Australia’s 474.
  • His innings was characterized by intelligent play, aggressive running, and adept shot selection against top Australian bowlers.
  • Prior to his century, Reddy demonstrated potential with strong performances in previous innings, scoring 41 and 38 not out earlier in the series.
  • Despite the pressure, particularly nearing his century, Reddy maintained focus and composure, ultimately guiding India towards a potentially competitive position in the match.
“The skill, the composure, and the degree of difficulty means it’s an innings that should sit in the top tier of MCG centuries.”

Reddy's outstanding performance not only highlights his potential as a future star for India but also renews hope in the team's chances in the current Test match against Australia.

item.title: OnePlus 13R 6,000mAh battery confirmed, Early-bird offers revealed - gizmochina
item.description:
OnePlus 13R Battery Capacity and Early-Bird Offers Announced

Publication Date: December 28, 2024 | Source: Gizmochina

The OnePlus 13R features a 6,000mAh battery, which is the same as the flagship OnePlus 13. Early-bird offers include a $50 discount for pre-ordering.

  • The Ace 5 series includes a standard and Pro model; the OnePlus 13R is set to launch globally.
  • The Ace 5 in China has a 6,400mAh battery capacity, while the 13R is confirmed at 6,000mAh.
  • The 13R may launch in a 12GB + 256GB variant with two color options: Nebula Noir and Astral Trail.
  • Reservations for the 13R are open for $50, which provides additional discounts and gifts worth $229.
“This battery can support up to 23 hours of video playback with some charge remaining.”

In conclusion, the OnePlus 13R is generating excitement with its battery capacity and attractive pre-order offers, indicating strong consumer interest ahead of its release.

item.title: Elon Musk backs AfD party in German newspaper opinion piece - DAWN.com
item.description:
Elon Musk backs AfD party in German newspaper opinion piece

Publication Date: Saturday

Source: Welt am Sonntag

US billionaire Elon Musk has expressed his support for the Alternative for Germany (AfD) party through a guest opinion piece, leading to the resignation of the opinion editor at the publication.

  • Musk claims that “only the AfD can save Germany” in his commentary.
  • He argues that portraying the AfD as right-wing extremist is misleading, citing the party leader's personal life.
  • The piece has stirred significant controversy, prompting discussions about freedom of expression in journalism.
  • The AfD is positioned second in opinion polls ahead of upcoming elections in Germany.
  • Germany’s domestic intelligence agency has classified the AfD as a suspected extremism case since 2021.
“Democracy and journalism thrive on freedom of expression. This includes dealing with polarising positions and classifying them journalistically.” - Jan Philipp Burgard

The discussion surrounding Musk's opinion raises important questions about the intersection of celebrity influence and political discourse in Germany.

item.title: ‘Forcible evacuation’ of fasting farmer leader will lead to ‘collateral damage’: Punjab to Supreme Court - The Hindu
item.description:
Punjab Government Cautions Supreme Court on Forcible Evacuation of Farmer Leader

Date: December 28, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The Punjab government warned the Supreme Court that forcibly evacuating farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal, who is on a hunger strike, could lead to serious repercussions for both police and the protesting farmers.

  • Dallewal has been fasting at the Khanauri border since November 26, demanding legal guarantees for minimum support prices (MSP) for crops.
  • The Supreme Court suggested that the situation could be de-escalated with intervention from the Centre.
  • 3,000 people are gathered at the protest site, creating a strong resistance against any attempts to evacuate Dallewal.
  • The court has given the Punjab government more time to comply with hospitalisation orders for Dallewal.
“What is the Centre doing to defuse the situation? Are you doing something?” - Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia

The ongoing dispute highlights the intense standoff between the farmers and the government, stressing the urgent need for engagement to avoid further escalations.

item.title: On Congress Attacks Over Manmohan Singh Funeral, JP Nadda's 'Super PM' Swipe - NDTV
item.description:
On Congress Attacks Over Manmohan Singh Funeral, JP Nadda's 'Super PM' Swipe

Date: New Delhi
Source: News Article

Following the cremation of former Prime Minister Dr. Manmohan Singh, Congress leaders Rahul and Priyanka Gandhi criticized the BJP for 'insulting' his memory. BJP President JP Nadda accused Congress of playing 'cheap politics' regarding the former PM's funeral arrangements.

  • Dr. Singh was cremated with full state honours at Nigambodh Ghat in Delhi.
  • Congress demanded a memorial site befitting Dr. Singh's stature, which they believe was not honored by the BJP.
  • Rahul Gandhi stated the BJP 'totally insulted' Dr. Singh by choosing the cremation site.
  • JP Nadda defended the government's decisions, arguing that space for a memorial would be allocated.
  • The controversy highlights ongoing political tensions surrounding the legacy of Manmohan Singh.
Rahul Gandhi: "Dr Manmohan Singh deserves our highest respect and a memorial. The government should have shown respect..."

The incident reflects the deep political divide in India regarding the reverence shown to former leaders, particularly in the context of the late Dr. Singh's legacy.

item.title: South Africa stumbles to 27-3 in pursuit of tricky 148-run target in 1st test against Pakistan - Hindustan Times
item.description:
South Africa stumbles to 27-3 in pursuit of tricky 148-run target in 1st test against Pakistan

Date: Dec 28, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

South Africa's top-order struggled against Pakistan's pace attack, heading towards an exciting finish as they pursue a tricky target of 148 runs set by Pakistan.

  • Marco Jansen took six wickets, ensuring South Africa bowled out Pakistan for 237 runs.
  • South Africa is under pressure, currently at 27-3 at stumps, needing a win in one of the two matches to secure a spot in the World Test Championship final.
  • Fast bowler Mohammad Abbas made a significant impact returning to test cricket after a three-year absence.
  • Aiden Markram remains unbeaten on 22, while captain Temba Bavuma is yet to score.
“South Africa needs to secure a win in one of the two tests against Pakistan to make it to the World Test Championship final.”

This match proves pivotal for South Africa as they face a challenging second innings against Pakistan's formidable bowling attack.

item.title: Video: In A First, Israel Uses US Anti-Missile THAAD system To Counter Houthi Attack - News18
item.description:
Israel Deploys THAAD System for First Time Against Houthi Missile Attack

Date: December 28, 2024 | Source: News18

In a significant military development, Israel successfully engaged a ballistic missile launched from Yemen by Houthi rebels using the U.S. Terminal High Altitude Area Defense (THAAD) system. This marks the first recorded use of THAAD by Israel.

  • THAAD was deployed in Israel in October 2024.
  • American soldier footage shows the THAAD interceptor launch, highlighting the anticipation of success after many years.
  • The Israeli Defense Forces confirmed the interception, although not the specifics of THAAD's involvement.
  • THAAD is designed to intercept various missile ranges and relies on kinetic energy for neutralization.
  • The deployment follows multiple Houthi missile attacks targeting Israel, notably Ben Gurion Airport.
“Eighteen years I’ve been waiting for this.” - American soldier during THAAD test

This event underlines the escalating military tensions in the region, especially with continued Houthi aggression against Israel.

item.title: Carlsen Quits Rapid & Blitz Championships; Murzin, Duda, Arjun, Grischuk Lead Open - Chess.com
item.description:
Carlsen Withdraws from Rapid and Blitz Championships Amid Dress Code Dispute

Publication Date: December 28, 2024
Source: Chess.com

In a surprising turn of events, GM Magnus Carlsen announced his withdrawal from the ongoing 2024 FIDE World Rapid Chess Championship and the FIDE World Blitz Chess Championship due to a conflict regarding the dress code. Finishing the Rapid championship with a score of 5 out of 8, Carlsen's withdrawal guarantees new champions in both formats.

  • Carlsen received a $200 fine for wearing jeans and refused to change.
  • GMs Volodar Murzin, Jan-Krzysztof Duda, Arjun Erigaisi, and Alexander Grischuk lead the Open championship with 7 points.
  • The final rounds for the Open and Women's championships will determine the world champions.

"I said I'll change tomorrow... but they said you have to change now & it became a matter of principle for me so here we are! Honestly I'm too old at this point to care too much." — Magnus Carlsen

This incident has sparked significant discussions on social media, particularly focusing on the enforcement of FIDE’s dress regulations and their implications for players.

FIDE confirmed the long-established dress code rules and stated that they serve to ensure professionalism and fairness among competitors. The dynamic nature of the championship continues as leaders and competitors strategize for the final rounds.

As Carlsen leaves the competition, the landscape of the tournament remains charged with anticipation as players vie for titles in his absence, marking a turning point in the championship's narrative.

item.title: Magnus Carlsen breaks silence after quitting World Chess Championship over shocking jeans row: ‘Honestly, I am…’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Magnus Carlsen Walks Out of Championship Over Jeans Controversy

Date: Dec 28, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The world champion Magnus Carlsen left the World Rapid and Blitz Chess Championships after being told he could not compete in jeans.

  • Carlsen was in New York for the championship when he was informed about the dress code violation.
  • He initially offered to change his jeans for the next day but was fined and told to change immediately.
  • After being prohibited from participating, Carlsen famously expressed his frustration and walked out.
  • Carlsen stated he would not appeal the ruling, citing his age and indifference to the situation.
  • The head of FIDE clarified that Carlsen was not disqualified and could continue in the tournament the next day.
“Honestly, I am too old at this point to care too much.” – Magnus Carlsen

Carlsen’s departure adds a dramatic twist to this year’s championship and raises questions about the enforcement of dress codes in professional chess.

item.title: Vijay Sales' Apple Days Sale: Big discounts on iPhone 16 Pro Max, MacBook Pro Series and more | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Vijay Sales’ Apple Days Sale: Big discounts on iPhone 16 Pro Max, MacBook Pro Series and more

Date: 29 December 2024 - 5 January 2025

Source: Live Mint

The year-end shopping season brings significant discounts on a variety of Apple products during Vijay Sales’ Apple Days Sale, including iPhones, MacBooks, iPads, and more.

  • iPhone 16 Pro available for ₹106,900, discounted from ₹119,900.
  • iPhone 16 Pro Max 256GB priced at ₹130,650, with an effective offer price of ₹127,650.
  • iPhone 15 128GB available for ₹60,490, further reduced to ₹57,490.
  • MacBook Air with M3 chip starting at ₹103,390, discounted to ₹93,390.
  • iPad 10th Gen priced at ₹32,499, further reduced to ₹29,499.
  • Clearance discounts on open-box units starting at ₹32,900 for iPhone 13.
  • Partnerships with major banks offer instant discounts of up to ₹10,000.
“Shoppers who participate in the MyVS loyalty programme can earn points equivalent to 0.75 per cent of their total purchase value.”

In conclusion, the Apple Days Sale provides an excellent opportunity for Apple fans to purchase their favorite products at reduced prices, along with additional bank and loyalty discounts.

item.title: ‘Heartening to see Kashmiris open homes to stranded’: As temperature plummets in Valley, tales of warmth - The Indian Express
item.description:
Kashmiris Open Homes to Stranded Tourists Amid Heavy Snowfall

Publication Date: December 2024
Source: The Indian Express

The early snowfall in Kashmir has resulted in unexpected warmth from locals, who are opening their homes and mosques to assist stranded tourists and residents as heavy snow made roads impassable.

  • Hundreds of tourists stranded due to heavy snowfall on the Srinagar-Jammu highway.
  • Locals opened homes and mosques to provide shelter and warmth to those affected.
  • About 1,000 tourists accommodated in Gund, with women and children sheltered in homes and men in the Jamia Masjid.
  • The snowfall was significant, with eight inches recorded in Srinagar and up to two feet in some southern areas.
  • The heavy snow led to power outages and road closures, with authorities working to restore services.
“Heartening to see Kashmiris opening their masjids and homes to stranded tourists amidst heavy snowfall.” - Mirwaiz Umar Farooq

This event highlights the spirit of hospitality in Kashmir as the community rallies to support those in need during severe weather conditions.
